revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== {{suffix|en|Xerox|oid}} ===Noun=== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|informal}} An [[employee]] of {{w|Xerox}}. #* '''1978''', Patrick Firpo, Lester Alexander, Claudia Katayanagi, ''Copyart: the first complete guide to the copy machine'' (page 17) #*: A fine equal to the original sales commission is deducted from their paychecks â€” even if the commission went to a predecessor in that territory. Is it any wonder '''Xeroids''' try harder? #* '''2001''', ''The Business Week'' (issues 3739-3746, page 79) #*: Skeptics say Mulcahy belongs to the old guard herself, a veteran '''Xeroid''' who started 25 years ago selling copiers. They regard her as part of a past that weighs heavily on Xerox: a culture paralyzed by politics and earlier success. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=deiorx|rexoid}}
